member.name: T:ETLBox.DataFlow.Connectors.CsvDestination`1
member.summary: A Csv destination defines a csv file where data from the flow is inserted.

example.code: CsvDestination<MyRow> dest = new CsvDestination<MyRow>("/path/to/file.csv"); dest.Wait(); //Wait for all data to arrive

member.name: P:ETLBox.DataFlow.Connectors.CsvDestination`1.Configuration
member.summary: The CsvHelper Configuration. E.g. you can change the delimiter or the escape character here.

member.name: M:ETLBox.DataFlow.Connectors.CsvDestination`1.#ctor(System.String)
member.param: The destination csv file name or uri

member.name: T:ETLBox.DataFlow.Connectors.CsvSource`1
member.summary: Reads data from a csv source. While reading the data from the file, data is also asnychronously posted into the targets. Data is read a as string from the source and dynamically converted into the corresponding data format.

member.name: P:ETLBox.DataFlow.Connectors.CsvSource`1.Configuration
member.summary: The CsvHelper Configuration. E.g. you can change the delimiter or the escape character here.

member.name: P:ETLBox.DataFlow.Connectors.CsvSource`1.FieldHeaders
member.summary: The parsed header names from the csv

member.name: P:ETLBox.DataFlow.Connectors.CsvSource`1.IsHeaderRead
member.summary: True if the header was already set

member.name: M:ETLBox.DataFlow.Connectors.CsvSource`1.#ctor(System.String)
member.param: The source csv file name or uri
